channel.title: Structures :: Data Structures in C#
channel.description: Structures A structure is similar to a class, except that it is a value type, whereas a class is a reference type. A structure definition looks a lot like a class definition; for example, the following defines a structure for storing information associated with a name: /// <summary> /// Stores a frequency and a rank. /// </summary> public readonly struct FrequencyAndRank { /// <summary> /// Gets the Frequency. /// </summary> public float Frequency { get; } /// <summary> /// Gets the Rank.
